bitswapper.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /****************************************************************************
00002 *
00003 * The bitswapper was written to swap a file which was read back from the
00004 * RCU Flash memory in an 8 bit manner. This means when the read back file
00005 * shows an AA99 5566 pattern, this will be swapped to 99AA 6655.
00006 *
00007 * In this way it is possible to read the RCU configuration from the RCU
00008 * Flash memory and generate the RCU bitfile from it, to program other RCUs
00009 * with the same configuration.
00010 *
00011 *
00012 * written by Dominik Fehlker, Dominik.Fehlker@uib.no
00013 ******************************************************************************/
00014 
00015 
00016 #include <stdio.h>
00017 #include <stdlib.h>
00018 #include <string.h>
00019 #include <unistd.h>
00020 #include <sys/types.h>
00021 #include <linux/types.h>
00022 #include <sys/stat.h>
00023 //#include "dcscMsgBufferInterface.h"
00024 #include <linux/errno.h>
00025 #include <fcntl.h>
00026 
00027 
00028 
00029 int main(int argc, char **argv){
00030    __u8 *pSrc;
00031    __u8 *pTgt, *pTgtoutput;
00032    int filesize, n;
00033    FILE *inputfile, *outputfile;
00034    filesize = 0;
00035 
00036 
00037 
00038   if(argc != 3) {
00039     printf("usage: bitswapper <inputfile> <outputfile>\n"); 
00040     return EXIT_FAILURE;
00041    }
00042   
00043    filesize = getFileSize(argv[1]);
00044    printf("filesize= %d for file %s\n", filesize, argv[1]);
00045 
00046    //open inputfile for reading
00047    if((inputfile=fopen(argv[1],"r")) < 0){
00048     printf("Could not open %s for reading!\n",argv[1]);
00049     return EXIT_FAILURE;
00050    }
00051 
00052 
00053   
00054    pSrc = (__u8*)malloc(filesize*sizeof(__u8));
00055    printf("Allocated source memory area\n");
00056    pTgtoutput = pTgt = (__u8*)malloc(filesize*sizeof(__u8));
00057    printf("Allocated  target memory area\n");  
00058 
00059 
00060    fread(pSrc, filesize, 1, inputfile);
00061 
00062    swab(pSrc, pTgt, filesize);
00063 
00064    printf("before: %#x, after: %#x: \n",*pSrc, *pTgt);
00065    
00066 
00067    //open the outputfile for writing
00068    if((outputfile=fopen(argv[2],"a+b")) < 0){
00069      printf("Error opening %s for writing!\n",argv[2]);
00070      return EXIT_FAILURE;
00071    }
00072    
00073    //write the swapped data to the file
00074    fwrite(pTgtoutput, sizeof(__u8),filesize , outputfile);
00075 
00076    free(pSrc);
00077    free(pTgtoutput);
00078 
00079    fclose(outputfile);
00080    fclose(inputfile);
00081 
00082    return EXIT_SUCCESS;
00083 }
00084 
00085 
00086 
00087 
00088 int getFileSize(char *path){
00089    unsigned long size;
00090    size_t filesize;
00091    struct stat statbuf;
00092    size = -1;
00093 
00094 
00095    if ((lstat(path, &statbuf)) == -1 ){
00096         perror("Pfadfehler");
00097         return EXIT_FAILURE;
00098    }
00099 
00100    //read the filesize
00101    //fstat(initconfig, &statbuf);
00102    filesize = statbuf.st_size;
00103    size = (int)filesize;
00104 
00105 return size;
00106 }
